text: I wonder if whoever designed [[!Selvala, Explorer Returned]] imagined all the rules shenanigans that would happen when they created her card.
It's weird when you draw a card as a part of a mana ability.

Yup. Reason I bring it up is I was thinking about it in terms with [[!Vizier of the Menagerie]] on the field.
Look at the top card, go to cast it, look at the NEXT card... do I want it? Activate Selvala and draw it.
That art always makes me smile, it feels sillier than it should be
“Why hello, I have this insect.”
Hahaha. That’s all I’m going to see now.
While listening to this week's Commander's Brew I just realized...why isn't [[Daxos the Returned]] an enchantment creature?

attachments.fallback: Daxos the Returned {1}{W}{B} // Legendary Creature — Zombie Soldier // Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you get an experience counter. // {1}{W}{B}: Create a white and black Spirit enchantment creature token. It has "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of experience counters you have." // 2/2
attachments.text:
Legendary Creature — Zombie Soldier
Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you get an experience counter. 
{1}{W}{B}: Create a white and black Spirit enchantment creature token. It has "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of experience counters you have."
*2/2*

text: I mean, if he cares so much about enchantments, why not make him one?
If Mizzix cares so much about instants and sorceries, why not make her one?
Are there Instant/Sorcery creatures?
Jokes aside, he's not nyxborn, he's just a zombie
Nah, there aren't
Actually technically there are since there are tribal sorceries/instants with Changeling that have all creature types :wink:

I mean, they're not creatures. And those instants/sorceries don't have creature types. This is why Tribal is considered a Card Type and not a Supertype like Legendary. Those creature types belong to the Tribal type, not the instant/sorcery type
legit not kidding, nerds everywhere are sad about this
I mean, they do have every creature type, so an argument could be made...
But like "Elf" is not a Sorcery subtype. "There are Tribal Sorcery -- Elf" cards, but that's different than "Sorcery -- Arcane." Elf is a tribal subtype, Arcane in a sorcery subtype
Sure, but they trigger any tribal synergies when you cast them.
Commander 2019: Legendary Instant Creatures
Just add water

Yeah. I'm just being a nerd over here. There aren't instant/sorcery creatures, even the ones with creature types. And there technically aren't instants/sorceries with creature types either, there are Tribals with creature types that also happen to be instants/sorceries too. It's weird and confusing and a sad workaround for what should have been a Supertype like Legendary but they were too scared to make happen in case it broke the rules in half and made every card with Changeling also a Forest because Dryad Arbor exists
The net result is the same, though, so they are effectively instants/sorceries creatures, even if technically they aren't.
they're not instants/sorceries with power and toughness so i don't think i agree with you?
Nor do you have to.
That said, you could make a very janky zur brew by tutoring up [[Arcane Adaptation]], choose Enchantment and subsequently get any creature 3 CMC or less in your deck to the field.

attachments.fallback: Arcane Adaptation {2}{U} // Enchantment // As Arcane Adaptation enters the battlefield, choose a creature type. // Creatures you control are the chosen type in addition to their other types. The same is true for creature spells you control and creature cards you own that aren't on the battlefield.
attachments.text:
Enchantment
As Arcane Adaptation enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Creatures you control are the chosen type in addition to their other types. The same is true for creature spells you control and creature cards you own that aren't on the battlefield.

for creatures

It's the card I wish disrupt decorum was.
Ugh my head. If timesifer is out and someone time stretches.... I don't even know
Sad days for the Time stretcher. They get their next turn but at upkeep Timesifter’s ability triggers.
They MIGHT get that next turn or someone else would. After that they get another bite at the Apple.
When Timesifter’s ability triggers again.
They technically got the turn.
They still get their extra turns, but conceivably they never actually happen.
[[timesifter]]

attachments.fallback: Timesifter {5} // Artifact // At the beginning of each upkeep, each player exiles the top card of his or her library. The player who exiled the card with the highest converted mana cost takes an extra turn after this one. If two or more players' cards are tied for highest cost, the tied players repeat this process until the tie is broken.

Artifact
At the beginning of each upkeep, each player exiles the top card of his or her library. The player who exiled the card with the highest converted mana cost takes an extra turn after this one. If two or more players' cards are tied for highest cost, the tied players repeat this process until the tie is broken.
attachments.title: Timesifter {5}

text: Hrm...this does get messy. If Timesifter was out, then that person was supposed to take the next extra turn. Ok, I give. I thought I had it in my head, but now I'm not sure about the order of precedence between resolved abilities like that.
It's almost like they tried to make everything as fucky as possible back then
Hrm...the only ruling on time stretch says "If multiple “extra turn” effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved."

So if timesifter's ability had already resolved (which it would), then you take the 2 extra turns from time stretch; however, on the first extra turn, timesifter's ability resolves so that person takes the next turn. Technically Time Stretch's ability is still in effect, but it's like stacking responses on the stack, since each upkeep timesifter's ability will resolve.
I suspect that's how it works.
So Time Stretch will get you 1 extra turn, effectively.
Ok, according to Judge Chat, so long as Timesifter remains in play, the Time Stretch player will not get their second extra turn, though technically it is part of the current game state.
Once Timesifter is removed and its extra turns are completed, then the Time Stretch player gets their second extra turn and then normal turns resume.

My soul hurt reading that. Lol Thank you.

I should add in the chaos article a "quiz time" where people have to answer what would happen in these cases
I like thorny puzzles like that. It mostly requires an understanding of how gamestate is managed in MTG and most of it really works like the stack.
Most of it.
most of the time

For the hell of it, throw Eye of the Storm in there
Omen Machine really screws with control decks
And Possibility storm. Wahahahaha
Because if you flip a counter spell, you have no valid targets so it remains in exile.
